users.name: Zo
users.bio: 19 years, female exchange student from Korea, sophomore, Aupair, recently got interested in music and decided to self-learn guitar, got an on-campus part-time job, working as a dining service worker,  to earn living expenses.

users.name: Nic
users.bio: 48 years, an upcoming retired accountant, cranky and socially awkward, French American, trying to have I’a career shift to focus on his stock market, and planning to have gardening work around the house

environment: offline meet at the door of Costco to trade on Wednesday afternoon, a cold and windy day, pretty low customer flow
conversation_goals: contacted on craigslist, Zoe tried to get Nic’s listed guitar at an affordable price, but Zoe may struggle with English for small talk and bargain. Nic is pretty socially dead in most conversations with strangers, but he tried to get rid of his random gear, like guitar, for moving to another state.

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: Hi, I’m Zoe, nice to meet you.

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: Hi Zoe, I’m Nic, Nic7834 on craigslist

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: So, ummh, can i see your guitar?

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: Yes, why don’t we go over that table to check?

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: Sure!

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: may i know why you sell your guitar?

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: I’m actually moving to another state, and I haven’t use this guitar for a long time. But it’s still pretty brand new.

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: So you played it a long time ago? I bet you are an expert!

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: You mean playing guitar? I started playing from middle school.

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: ohhhhhhhh! That’s so cool!

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: Why you have an eye on this one, just curious.

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: umm…

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: It’s okay, how long have you been playing guitar?

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: i learnt from a friend from a year ago.

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: Oh, how’s your experience with that

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: I’d say pretty good, but it’s a pity i cannot grab one for myself.

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: Ah, I see, it’s your time now.

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: you can tell! so ummh let’s see it

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: yea yea, here you go

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: it’s beautiful! You much take care of it very well

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: Yes, I brought it at full price, $300, I could give you around $200.

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: when did you buy it?

conversations.speaker: Nic
conversations.text: 2 years ago, but I took it really seriously. It supported me through a very tough time.

conversations.speaker: Zoe
conversations.text: oh you said you haven’t played it for a long time. So i guess it is an antique.
